p: The essential oils from some Baccharis species were previously subjected to a screening procedure in order to verify their larvicidal activity against late-third/early-fourth A. aegypti larvae. At a concentration of 100 μg mL −1, following percentages of mortality were observed: B. dracunculifolia (55–65%), B. genistelloides (20%) B. pentandlii (40%) and B. salicifolia (40%). Due to different collection places, B. latifolia induced 35% of mortality or absence of any activity. However, LC 50 values of aforementioned essential oils were not estimated [ 49].
